intro: Senecio barahonensis, commonly known as the Barahon Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the island of Barahona in the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio barahonensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
